review_blob: Another excellent offering from de Garde. A nice blended wild farmhouse with notes of the wine and gin barrels its aged in. Not too boozy or sour. Nice and tart. Pours a cloudy golden color with a nice white foamy head.
Pours a hazy golden color with a white foamy/frothy head. Nice aroma of bitter fruity hops. Taste is excellent, nice and sour with notes of the riseling grapes and a bitter finish from the hops.

An absolutely fantastic beer again from TG. Poured from bomber into Snifter. 

Pours a hazy orange with a solid white head with great lacing. 

Floral and fruity aroma. Awesome citra hop bomb.

I must have had an off batch going by other ratings but this beer was way too complex and boozy for me. 

So many flavors hitting at once, a bit overkill. Definitely taste the raisins and rum/brandy barreling.

Poured from bomber into snifter. 

Tons of coffee on the nose. A really nice thick mouthfeel with loads of coffee taste. Nice and not too boozy. Not too sweet, lots of roast on this.

Poured from a fresh bottle into a pint glass (didnt have any others at the time). 

Nice, slightly hazy, golden-yellow pour with a bright white head. 

Grapefruit on the nose, a hoppy and citrusy but not too bitter DIPA. Not boozy. Excellent beer
